abstract: Some games are performing better on the Xbox 360 than on the PlayStation 3. Are developers having trouble mastering the PS3’s quirks?
snippet: Some games are performing better on the Xbox 360 than on the PlayStation 3. Are developers having trouble mastering the PS3’s quirks?
lead_paragraph: A video game review published this week in USA Today has set off the latest tit-for-tat among the loyalists of the Xbox 360 and its rival, the PlayStation 3.

abstract: My desktop computer runs Microsoft Windows XP Home Edition — which includes Microsoft Works Spreadsheet — but I cannot open Excel spreadsheets. How can I open them?
snippet: My desktop computer runs Microsoft Windows XP Home Edition — which includes Microsoft Works Spreadsheet — but I cannot open Excel spreadsheets. How can I open them?
lead_paragraph: Q. My desktop computer runs Microsoft Windows XP Home Edition — which includes Microsoft Works Spreadsheet — but I cannot open Excel spreadsheets. How can I open them?

abstract: Another explanation for the slow pace of video game releases for the Sony PlayStation 3.
snippet: Another explanation for the slow pace of video game releases for the Sony PlayStation 3.
lead_paragraph: In yesterday’s post about the game console battle between Microsoft and Sony, I noted that the big publisher Electronic Arts has been releasing games for Microsoft’s Xbox 360 many weeks, even months, before releasing them for the Sony PlayStation 3.

headline.main: Sony v. Microsoft (With Helmets): The Sequel
